intro: Pouzolzia dewevrei, commonly known as the dwarf pouzolzia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, ovate leaves with a rough texture and a distinctive reddish or purple coloration on the underside. It produces tiny, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, Pouzolzia dewevrei is adapted to thrive in poor soils and withstand drought conditions.
